channel.title: Mute help
channel.description:
For some reason when i mute people they can still talk. I have looked around and people have the same problem but can't find a fix. Its not the command, And its not in the connections.java. Help??
Its a 317/pi

item.title: Mute help
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

Make a check to see if they’re muted when the player pushes text, if they’re muted send a message.

Read full topic

item.title: Mute help
item.dc:creator: @drew56133 drew56133
item.description:
@drew56133 wrote:

[quote=“i am infamy, post:4, topic:473827”]The “mute” command you have is fine,The problem is in Connection.java this is how you fix it

Search in
Connection.java

public static boolean isMuted(Client c) {
//return mutedNames.contains(c.playerName) || mutedIps.contains(c.connectedFrom); 
return false;
}

Then Replace it With this Command

public static boolean isMuted(Client c) { return mutedNames.contains(c.playerName) || mutedIps.contains(c.connectedFrom); } [/quote]
Can you read above that its not my connections.java.

Read full topic

item.title: Mute help
item.dc:creator: @i_am_infamy i am infamy
item.description:
@i_am_infamy wrote:

The “mute” command you have is fine,The problem is in Connection.java this is how you fix it

Search in
Connection.java

public static boolean isMuted(Client c) {
//return mutedNames.contains(c.playerName) || mutedIps.contains(c.connectedFrom); 
return false;
}

Then Replace it With this Command

public static boolean isMuted(Client c) {
    return mutedNames.contains(c.playerName) || mutedIps.contains(c.connectedFrom);
}

Read full topic

item.title: Mute help
item.dc:creator: @drew56133 drew56133
item.description:
@drew56133 wrote:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("mute") && c.playerRights >= 3) { try { String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(5); Connection.addNameToMuteList(playerToBan); for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i]; c2.sendMessage("You have been muted by: " + c.playerName); break; } } } } catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline."); } }

Read full topic
